Media Coverage

“I care about how you showcase your ability to do what you claim you can do and why you do it the way you do it.I care more about experience over hype.And… Im not the only one.”

- Loren Weisman

Oak & Teak – Hot Materials for Luxury Furniture Designs

The current focus is on sustainability and therefore natural materials like wood, veneer, glass and stone are trending at the moment. No matter how many new materials would come in the market, wood mainly hardwood is the most classic and sought-after option for creating luxury furniture.

This Women Entrepreneur’s Keen Eye helps create Bespoke Furniture for Contemporary Indian Consumers

According to entrepreneur AnupriyaSahu, Co-founder & Designer of Alankaram, a bespoke furniture design practice, this boom has been brought owing to various consumer and market.

How to use viva magenta in home interiors

As we usher in a brand new year, it is a time for new beginnings and a fresh start to many things in life. It is also a time to embrace novel trends and get yourself updated with things in vogue for the coming year. And one announcement that most designers and décor enthusiasts look forward to at the beginning of each year is the Pantone colour of the year.

How to make a space productive using the right furniture

Unprecedented times due to the pandemic compelled people to spend most of their time indoors. As a result, most homeowners reconsidered their existing interior layout, wherein their existing homes function as offices, schools, entertainment zones and more.

Profiling interview with Anupriya

Anupriya Sahu was born and brought up in a town called Sagar in Madhya Pradesh. Art and design have always inspired and intrigued her. The creative streak might have emerged as she grew up in a house steeped in the arts — her mother was an artist, and father, a civil engineer.

Rapid fire round with Anupriya Sahu

She talks about the inspiration behind her firm’s name, insights behind her furniture studio practice, signature style and more..

Move over Scandi, Japandi is here

Minimalist yet welcoming, Japandi first made its appearance in 2016. It continues to be a bang-on trend known for its blend of Scandinavian design with Japanese aesthetic

Four ways to bring Scandinavian décor into your home

This interior style makes the most of natural light and pristine colours such as white, beige and other pastel hues of the colour wheel. Ar Anupriya Sahu, Founder and Design Head of a luxury design company shares some ways of bringing this clean-lined, practical and inviting decor into your home

Incorporating furniture in Japandi style

Indicative of its name, Japandi is a hybrid decor style that melds core design principles and aesthetics of Japanese and Scandinavian interiors. Japandi merges functionality with simplicity and craftsmanship.

5 teakwood must-haves to add timeless charm to your spaces

Alankaram’s latest collection Manoram translates from Sanskrit to beauty, refection and impression – and the masterfully curated teakwood furniture offerings espouse just that! We list five of their latest pieces, perfectly suited to adorn your bedrooms.

How to find and style furniture with regional influence

Homeowners always wish to lend personality to their residence through furniture, artwork and décor pieces. All of us have a unique taste in products that are meaningful to us, often derived from varied cultures. As furniture pieces are more than functional devices, products sourced from specific regions tell stories through their design, upholstery and materiality.

New-Age Work From Home Setup

Looking to boost your productivity and foster your work-life balance as the hybrid work-from-home system is now a permanent part of our lives? We got you sorted with some ideas for new age work-from-home setup by home interior decor experts

Cheat Code to Selecting the Perfect Sofa

There is a wide range of sofa styles available today, varying from sectional sofas, sofa-cum-beds, chaise lounges, modern sofas, traditional diwan seatings and many more options. Here are a some tips by home interior decor experts for selecting the perfect sofa

Bespoke furniture is no more just a luxury piece

Re-Energise Your Home With These Decor Trends.

Here are some easy ways to transform your abode and enliven your mood.

Can better furniture make you a better worker?

Whether working from home or the office, it makes sense to invest in aesthetically pleasing furniture that’s functionally efficient, well-designed and suited for optimal body posture.

#AIAdores: 10 products that fuse traditional design with a modern aesthetic

While wooden furniture is often associated with rustic, traditional furniture, Alankaram, a leading home-grown furniture design studio, stands out with its contemporary, minimalistic designs and elegant usage of joineries. We list ten such products that seamlessly merge the two design sensibilites.

Upgrading skills is the way to success

Women should do more of what they love. Having supportive people in the form of family and the team makes the journey smooth and memorable, shares Anupriya Sahu, Founder and Design Head at Alankaram, in an exclusive discussion with 99acres on the occasion of Women’s Day.

Hotels and the art of design sensitivity

How hotels can introduce furniture that ensures the wellbeing of their guests

Wall mural ideas – 12 ways to make a big impact with paint, wallpaper and more

Experiment with these wall mural ideas and create incredible, inspiring interiors for your home

#LetsTalk: 4 ways to bring the vibrant Very Peri hue into your home

The dynamic Very Peri(winkle) blue shade took the design world by storm when Pantone announced that it was 2022’s Colour of the Year. Four industry professionals elaborate on bold and dramatic ways to incorporate the trendy colour inside your homes!

On Mixing and Matching Different Shades and Grains of Wooden Furnitur

In this exclusive, we explore the merits of mixing and matching different shades and grains of wooden furniturein a singular space. Alankaram shares insights on this burning topic. 

Women in design

An interview featuring the designers who should be on your radar, where Ar. Anupriya shares her journey through furniture design and establishing Alankaram.

Bed Designing

Tips on buying a bed that suits the home interiors and offers sound sleep

Expressive Interiors with Alankaram

Sticking to the path of creating innovative and functional furniture pieces for the past 10 years, Anupriya Sahu is back with another elite set-up of furniture for a residence in Surat designed by EssTeam Design Services LLP. Alankaram is a furniture design firm co-founded by Anupriya Sahu and it works towards creating bespoke furniture that blends well with the design quotient of a space.

Home Decor Tips for Winters

Winter is howling outside, and it’s time to add some cheer to your home. A fun way to add a touch of romance to your winter living room is to add lots of candles. Also, while deep, rich colours are typically used for winter decor to keep everything light and bright, furniture with a simple design is unique and impressive.

Take a 360-degree approach to design

Furniture can be collected and incorporated into residential interiors in the same way that art from can

5 Ways to Choose the Right Furniture for Your Living Room

Take a 360-degree approach to design

To have a land in tier one cities where infrastructure rates are touching skies, small compact spaces are not stopping an individual’s life from having their dream home in the desired city. But many people having cozy spaces find it frustrating to fit in all their accommodation and end up creating a messy environment at homes.
